oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Scene from "Wild River" shows as an old shack on "Garth Island"
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Photograph of a dilapidated rural clapboard house. Visible are a stove-pipe chimney and covered front porch supported by four posts.

The movie "Wild River" (1960) brought attention to the thousands of Tennesseans who had been forced to abandon their homes and land to make way for the Tennessee Valley Authority. Directed by Elia Kazan, the motion picture starred Montgomery Clift and Lee Remick.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Tennessee Department of Conservation Photograph Collection, 1937-1976
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Motion pictures; Dwellings; Studio props
